bioghist.p: Robert M. Peck studied history and archeology at Princeton University. He is a Fellow of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia, a writer, naturalist, and historian who has traveled extensively in North and South America, Africa, Asia and Europe. The author of A Celebration of Birds and Headhunters and Hummingbirds: An Expedition in Ecuador, Peck has written for a wide range of popular and scholarly magazines including Audubon, National Wildlife, International Wildlife, Arts, Antiques, Image, Terra, the Philadelphia Inquirer, and the New York Times. In 1991 he was awarded the Academy of Natural Sciences' Richard Hopper Day Medal for his work interpreting natural history to the public.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Robert M. Peck. Materials include: minutes, memos, planning notes and sketches related to various Academy projects and exhibitions, including diorama enhancement, the Discovering Dinosaurs exhibit, and a Brooke Dolan exhibit; correspondence, drafts, photocopies of Cassin correspondence, and other research materials assembled for his introduction to John Cassin's The Illustrations of the Birds of California, Texas, Oregon, British and Russian America; and correspondence related to various projects, including publication and publicity for Richard Ellis's books on whales, and a proposed Thomas Say postage stamp (1982-1986). The collection also includes correspondence and other papers related to Peck's work on Brooke Dolan and the "Dixie Mission" in Yenan. These papers include correspondence with W.J. Peterkin; an inventory of the Dolan collection; published volumes, including Yenan!: Colonel Wilbur Peterkin and the American military mission to the Chinese Communists, 1944-1945 by William P. Head, Dixie Mission: The United States Army Observer Group in Yenan, 1944 by David D. Barrett, and a copy of Annual Pictorial Magazine, 1991, which features the Dixie Mission story; and a series of photographs of Dolan in Yenan.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
